headline: Baker Hughes beats second-quarter profit estimates on strong demand for natgas technology
summary: Baker Hughes joined its U.S. rivals Halliburton and SLB in warning of a slowdown in upstream activity and spending, as producers grapple with weakness and volatility in commodity prices.  In North America, upstream spending is expected to be down in the low-double digits, Baker Hughes said on Tuesday, while international spending could be down in the high-single digits.  However, the Big 3 oilfield services firms are concentrating on pockets of resilience such as LNG infrastructure, power grid upgrades and data center-driven power demand to weather a slower, more uneven recovery.

headline: Halliburton CEO: Oil and gas markets are “softer” than expected and will remain weak for all of 2025
summary: The oil sector braces for a bearish back half of 2025 while remaining optimistic for the long run.

raw.headline: Halliburton CEO: Oil and gas markets are “softer” than expected and will remain weak for all of 2025

headline: Halliburton says Mexico oil output decline rates will pressure reactivation of business
summary: HOUSTON (Reuters) -U.S. oilfield service provider Halliburton on Tuesday said Mexico's crude production decline rates are creating pressure for a reactivation of business amid long delays from state-run Pemex to pay its suppliers.  Output of crude and condensate by Pemex, the largest producer in the country, fell 8.4% in May to 1.64 million barrels per day, according to official figures.

headline: SLB Awarded Carbon Storage Contract for Northern Endurance Partnership Project in UK
summary: LONDON, July 22, 2025--Global energy technology company SLB (NYSE: SLB) has been awarded a technologies and services contract for carbon storage site development in the North Sea by the Northern Endurance Partnership (NEP), an incorporated joint venture between bp, Equinor and TotalEnergies.

headline: Halliburton Stock Slips. CEO Sees Oil Services Demand Weakening.
summary: On Tuesday the company reported earnings-per-share of $0.55, equal to the median estimate in a FactSet survey.

headline: Halliburton profit slumps on weak North America, Middle East drilling demand
summary: The company had flagged a second-quarter earnings impact from President Donald Trump's tariffs and lower oilfield activity in North America as producers evaluated drilling and completions at weak oil prices.  "Oilfield services market will be softer than I previously expected over the short to medium term," Halliburton CEO Jeff Miller said in a statement.  North America quarterly revenue fell 9% to $2.26 billion, while its Middle East/Asia segment was down sequentially due to lower activity across multiple product service lines in Saudi Arabia and Kuwait.
